intro: Daemonorops jenkinsiana var. tenasserimica, commonly known as the Tenasserim palm, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant typically grows in humid, lowland areas with rich, well-drained soil. It produces small, clustered inflorescences and is often used in ornamental horticulture. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable in some regions.
